isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9200, 9300, 9400 Models Built After January 1, 1995 - ELECTRICAL TROUBLESHOOTING LIGHT SYSTEMS - OPERATION - CAB CLEARANCE AND IDENTIFICATION LIGHTS

svcproc.title: CAB CLEARANCE AND IDENTIFICATION LIGHTS
svcproc.para: As described in the cab and trailer lights switch and relay wiring operation section 10.2.2., power is fed to circuit 68E. It then flows through circuit 68D, fuse F8-C, circuit 68C, and 58A to the cab clearance and identification lights. After dividing up to flow through five lights, the power flows through ground circuits 11-GAC, 11-GAB, 11-GAC, and 11-GB to right dash ground stud.
